title: Is there any good tips for playing Ranked for the first time?
body:
I just reached the level to play ranked but I'm not so sure if I'm ready yet.
Can anyone please give me some tips?
Thank you

replies.body:
Definately do not jump straight into ranked. Generally the basic points are below.

- Have a fully completed rune page for each role.

- Be able to play approx 2 champs in each role.

- MAKE SURE YOU CAN PLAY SUPPORT BECAUSE YOU WILL GET AUTO FULLED FROM TIME TO TIME.

- Most importantly, make sure you feel that you are ready to go into ranked. Make sure you keep an open mind and try to stay positive. If you tilt pull out and try again later or the next day.

Enjoy and good luck. 

P.S. someone else will make a post with much better information above what i have provided ðŸ˜…

Also this was on mobile so there will be mistakes.

> Have a fully completed rune page for each role.

This ^

Highly important!

**Don't play as soon as you reach lvl 30.** 
_(everyone will say this, because we ALL made that mistake)_

It's better to wait and hone your skills before jumping in.
Get good with at least 2 champions per role, _(more in your primary)_.

Get familiar with **all** the champs in the game, by playing with and against them,_ (nothing is worse that being surprised in ranked, when they pick someone like Azir, or Kled who you never see much and you have no idea what they do.)_

Its better to wait a while playing normals, have fun, and enter at silver level, than enter at bronze and slog your way up. 

Pre-game _(champion select)_ is VERY important in ranked.
Picking/banning the right champions can be the difference between an easy win win and a crushing loss.

___________
**Banning**
___________
Be smart with your bans.
If you got destroyed by Corki last game, rather than just instabanning Corki **_COZ HE OP_**, think about how likely it is that there will be another one _(in Corki's case, quite unlikely)_, and ban someone who is more likely to be picked by the enemy. 

Also if you can avoid it, don't selfishly ban champs, for example: 
Kassadin hard counters my Aurelion Sol, so I could ban him and save myself the pain of a hellish lane. But that would only benefit me, not the team, so it'd be better to leave Kass open, and ban someone like Zac who is a bigger threat to the whole team.

If you don't know who to ban, generally the champs with high pick rates are good choices. 
Lee Sin
Caitlin
Yasuo
Lulu
etc.

I personally ban Lee Sin, because a good one is a menace, he is picked very often, and the people who play Lee Sin well, ONLY play Lee, so banning him throws them completely off their game.

___________
**Picking **
___________

It is very important to have something that resembles a balanced team 
The standard example of a balanced team is:
Damage (ADC)
Damage (MID)
Assistance (Support)
Tank (Top or Jung)
Bruiser (Top or Jung)

Different teams will affect the game in different ways.
A team with 3 damage champs and no tank, will dominate early, and probably mid game. But if the game gets to late, they WILL lose against a team with tanks.
While a team with 2 tanks and and 2 bruisers, will probably lose early game, struggle mid game, and will have the clear advantage in late game.

So when you are picking your champs, instead of thinking _"I want to play Teemo."_ look at your team. If you have no tanks, you will be of greater help to your team if you pick Shen or Nautilus instead. But if you already have 2 tanks, then Teemo is probably a better pick.
If your team is all AD damage, try to pick an AP champ, and vice versa. 

______

The best advice I can give you, is to remember that it is a team game!
You can't do everything on your own, and they can't do everything without you.
In whatever way you can; picking, banning, building, playing, etc. Try and use yourself to plug the holes left by your team.

If your Vayne is good, don't steal her glory, use your abilities and items to keep her alive. 
If your Katarina is terrible, go for the kills yourself, and don't risk yourself to save her.
If your Jarvan is building damage instead of tank, adjust your build to make yourself a little tanker.

Good luck if you choose to play!
But I would wait a while first.

You should play at least three hundred Normal games and win most of them before you play ranked, and out of those three you must have at least played two roles.
The first ten matches of the ranked game is provisional, try as hard as you can, don't worry if you lose a lot in the first ten matches.
After the first ten matches, you will be placed in a tier.
You can start to play ranked as early as possible, but it doesn't guarantee anything.
I played 6 ranked matches and only won one of them.

If you want to do well in ranked,

1) Gain 200 wins in normals.
2) Make sure you have proper rune pages for every role that you play.
3) Learn two champions in every role in case you get autofilled.
4) Watch pro player playing your main champions to get ideas, and **watch past the laning phase**, watch the whole game to see what they do.
5) Expect that your team will be monkeys and if anyone flames you instantly mute them, don't bother flaming back, even if you are right.

Now you are ready for ranked.
Always blame jg and support. They will love you for it.
Play it to have fun first and to win second. otherwise you may tilt.  no sweat, just treat it like a normals match but less messing about and be slightly more careful.

A tip from me a Jungle/Top main would be
1. For each lane learn to play at least 3 champions to at least a standard level.
(Standard being. Know how to farm at least 8cs per minute for lanes, or jungle know how to gank, know how to actually play your role properly and not feed. If you are in the lower ranks Bronze to Gold, make sure you play a champion that does not become useless if behind)
2. Make sure that one of these champions counter the other so if they get picked you will know how to beat them. For example, if you are a {{champion:75}}  player, and some guy on the other team picked it, and you don't know how to play a champion that counters it. You may be in some trouble if there isn't any nice guys that would help you out. So learn champions that counter your main.
For me, I am a master Yi main so whenever someoen picks my Main Champion {{champion:11}}  I know how to counter that by picking someone like {{champion:33}} {{champion:24}} .
3. Be confident, but not over confident. Make sure you know what you are doing and believe in yourself. But do not be overconfident as tat can ruin you games.
4. Trust your teammates and don't flame. There will be times when your team seems to be doing very terrible while you are doing fine and you will get angry but don't argue, try to help them out instead of complaining.
5. The Normal stuff. Make sure you ward carefully, ping when laners are missing EVEN IF YOU ARE DEAD. Because even if you are dead your opponent may not be, they can still go roam.
Practise how to CS and if you are falling behind make sure to help other lanes since if you stay in your lane chances are you will lose turrets, get tanked and killed more then lose the game. Roam if you are behind since chances are you can help someone else if not yourself.

6. This one can be ignored kindof, make sure you know how to build into a situation.....
Don't build pure magic resist if you are against a magic later but their AD is fed.... and the stuff.
By armour penetration of the enemies are tanky, if you are tank against an enemy of AOE abilities get {{item:3190}} 

These are the general stuff I learnt from playing ranked....
Last of all. DONT GIVE UP AND FEED. Remember if you make it to late game, it is no longer gold comparison but Skill comparison.
Late game Is what brings out the better team.

I feel like people are missing a very important (though not so obvious) point: Don't play ranked if you're angry or upset!

You might not think it, but the mindset you take into a game can (and usually, *will*) have a very significant impact on the game itself. Go in with a negative mindset, being angry, frustrated, upset, or just expecting to lose will more than likely cause you to play below your personal average and make more mistakes. It can also be said that you being in a negative mood can also drag your team mates down as well, causing them to play worse as well.

In the (very few) matches of ranked I've played when I have taken a positive mindset with me I've had outstanding games, regardless of the outcome. The people have been nice, there's been better coordination than I originally expected and even when things got a little negative it didn't drag the mood down too far. This doesn't just apply to ranked, though, it has worked in most/all other modes for me.

That said, when I first played ranked (as a "level 30 rush", mind you) I had 6 quite terrible games. I took a negative mindset with me, was expecting toxicity and losses, and that's all I got. Back then, I was the kind of player to blame team mates and not accept fault where it was due. I've changed a lot since then and have noticed that my games are a lot more positive now than they used to be.

None of this is to discredit the importance of knowledge, mechanics and the right preparation, though. They're all still very important, but so is your mood when playing. Quite simply; don't play competitively if you're in a bad mood.

Mute the enemy team always. If someone grieves you on your team mute them straight away. Focus on playing the game well and be alert and in the moment for what you're doing now and what you're going to do next. Swallow your pride, assess your mistakes and have a mindset of improvement. You can't win every game, and you will have issues on your team in some games (afks , trolls, inting). Ward, ping what you see on the map, Comms when someone flashes/uses summoner or uses their ult. Be an emotional support for your team / friendly and encouraging rather than flaming or tilting. Never give up (won last game with an afk 4v5).

Have fun - that's the purpose of the game!
best advice to play ranked once you rushed lvl 30, Don't !
